question.title: EdgeDriver Opens Brower but fails to open URL
question.body:
I am trying to automate the Edge browser with Selenium. Below are the things I have already checked, but when I run the code the browser opens and doesn't navigate to the URL.

  • No firewall is blocking.

  • PORT 9222 is empty

  • Profile is getting loaded successfully

  • Edge Version 142.0.3595.80 (Official build) (64-bit)

  • Using WebDriver Manager to download latest binary

  • Java version: C:\Program Files\Amazon Corretto\jdk21.0.9_10\bin\java.exe (OpenJDK)

  • Selenium: 4.8.3

Code used:

WebDriverManager.edgedriver().setup();
EdgeOptions options = new EdgeOptions();

options.addArguments("user-data-dir=C:\\Users\\XYZ\\AppData\\Local\\Microsoft\\Edge\\User Data");
options.setBinary("C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Microsoft\\Edge\\Application\\msedge.exe");
options.addArguments("--edge-skip-compat-layer-relaunch");
// options.addArguments("--no-sandbox");
// options.addArguments("--disable-dev-shm-usage");
// options.addArguments("--disable-gpu");
options.addArguments("--remote-debugging-port=4559");
options.addArguments("--start-maximized");
options.addArguments("enable-automation");
options.addArguments("ignoreProtectedModeSettings");
// options.addArguments("--headless=new");  // Uncomment to run headless

options.setExperimentalOption("excludeSwitches", List.of("enable-logging"));

driver = new EdgeDriver(options);
driver.get("https://www.google.com/");

Error received:

SessionNotCreated Could not start a new session. Response code 500. Message: session not created
from chrome not reachable

Can someone help me identify if there are any options I am missing which can help me to resolve this issue?

P.S. With Chrome, everything works fine.

answers.body:
Your first argument is missing the --"switch"

Simply using the command line with --user will make a difference you can test by run

start "" /max msedge --user-data-dir="%temp%/temp" --app=https://www.google.com

or

start "" msedge --start-maximized --user-data-dir="%temp%/temp" --app=https://www.google.com

USE

options.addArguments("--user-data-dir=C:/Users/XYZ/AppData/Local/Microsoft/Edge/User Data");

but ensure the path is valid and ideally NOT the current users everyday profile, use a different one.

As per comments there needs to be a version match between current EdgeDriver and the current major version of Edge.

Especially:
Use current stable Selenium i.e. October's 4.38.

question_comments.body: As Corey said, your version is really old. Get the latest and try again without all the arguments, etc. Once you get the basic browser working, then start adding arguments back in one at a time to test each one and find the issue. Also, Selenium now has a built in driver manager, selenium.dev/documentation/selenium_manager.

you are using a very old version of Selenium. You should upgrade and try again. I would remove WebDriverManager (and delete any drivers it installed), there is no need for it. Also, copy your profile somewhere else and point to that.. there are security restrictions using the default profile.

79823582.body: When passed through a webdriver, Edge and Chrome get the same arguments if they started with "--" or not. (i.e. user-data-dir and --user-data-dir do the same)
